reviews.review_msg: nah , I would not recommend any of you guys to take her courses!
bad teacher , terrible work ethics
I would recommend her

Dr, Graham was a great prof this term! his lectures were quite quite boring. I skipped a lot,  he just read off the slides which were uploaded on canvas anyway.  the a final which was super easy. All you had to do was know the books and go over the slides. Great course and you get to read a bunch of fun stories!

very boring lectures i found myself zoning out or doing other class work when i was there in lectures. books were not amazing. probably my least favorite class i've taken this entire year. you dont need to go to lectures just tutorials as they are for marks. scared for the final dont know what to expect.
super kind and caring prof, wants his students to do well. goes into a lot of detail and posts all slides online.

Dr. Graham is great, but I would say his lectures are kind of boring. You don't really need to show up though. there are 2 essays that are pretty straight forward given many options in terms for the prompt. I am pretty scared for the final, but hopefully it isn't too bad!

He is legitimately my favourite professor, and it was the only class I looked forward to. The lectures were amazing and he knew exactly what he was talking about - I just wished his lectures were longer, so he did not have to rush through them. There is lots of reading (five poetry books), but it was not too bad. Just a great prof.

I had Corey as a TA for Engl115 last fall. He is one of the best TA's I've encountered at SFU so far. He encourages engagement and class discussion with activities during tutorials/labs. He explains concepts well and his reasons for marking clearly. I would not hesitate to take a class with him again.
He is caring and patient with his students. Feel free to go to his office hours or mail him asking about the lecture and feedback on your essay. Steve is the best prof I have ever had!
Funny and caring, you will never get bored in his classes. However, this course is a little bit reading extensive, but it will reward you for small details throughout the given stories.
Coolest prof ever!!!!!!!!
Very funny, makes every class extremely interesting, tells a lot of things about book. You must read to succeed, that's enough to successfully complete course

Overall a good teacher, his lectures are pretty much alright and fun in some occasions; the thing is, he doesn't allow cellphones and also if you don't have a physical copy for the book they are going to read you're not allowed to use a copy from your laptop since electronic devices are not allowed; your only options are printing or buying the book

Matt was one of the best teachers if not the best teachers I have ever had. During my semester with him he was extremely accessible, gave his best to make sure we were well versed in what we were studying and more than anything was able to assist me in performing highly in a subject I was simply just expecting to pass, I would highly recommend him.

Weird gradings
Occasionally rude behaviour
Put little effort in preparation for class

Encourages group discussion in class, doesn't talk for too long. Personally don't think it's a heavy workload (few short essays, reading assigned books/ sections). If you like reading, writing, and exploring ideas, this professor is a good fit. Patient and helpful if you are having difficulty. Clear criteria/ feedback to score from B to A.

Matt is an incredible instructor who teaches course materials that relate to life experiences. He values students' opinions and is more of a group discussion facilitator than a lecturer. He's a bit of a tough grader but knows to reward effort when he sees it so don't try to plagiarize, just do your own work. And absolutely no cellphones in class.

pros + supports your opinion + movie(s) + drama(play partially in the class + watch) cons - for some people, taking part in the drama :p i think you can skip it, talking to him - again, for some people, explicit language in literature additional info  NO PHONE during lecture  try to avoid reading from phone, alternate is your laptop ofc
One of the best instructors, would definitely take another course with him.
Really inspiring and knowledgeable. As long as you do the readingthink muchshould be good.

I enjoyed this class, and I think Budra was a pretty good prof, but most of the marks come from essays which were marked quite hard for a 100-level course. The course readings were fun (except Lovecraft imo), but the course does not teach you how to write. If you are coming straight out of high school, maybe take a writing course first.

this was one of my favourite courses. Paul is hilarious, and clearly cares a lot about the subject, therefore the lectures were super enjoyable. His assignments were easy enough if you attended class and read all the books, but there were quite a few books to read. (6 novels and several short stories). I def recommend paul!!!

Dr.Solomon is the best English professor out there. To be very honest if you go to her lectures and pay attention you should do just fine in the class and even if you dont pay enough attention she has recordings. Final exam is all her notes she aint tryna trick you. 100% recommend. my TA was a tough marker but Dr.Diana was so so so awesome.

Professor Diana is an amazing professor!! Her lectures are full of exciting topics. We had to read 4 novels this semester, which were not terrible. The final exam was extremely fair as everything she said in the Lecture was in the exam. I wish more profs were like her, it would make learning so much fun. Lastly, my TA was amazing!!

Her lectures are a bit boring and she never responds to emails, but the books you read are very interesting. Marking is based of your TA and they mark pretty tough.  This class is not a class to improve your writing skills. Average for the written essay's were a C+.

Sophie was a good professor, her lectures were useful & helped with readings. The course had 2 heavy essays and she was lenient with the first essay deadline. Beware we are NEVER taught to write in this class. The TA's feedback on essays was minimal and unhelpful. The grading of this class is hard, especially given that we're first year students.
Super kind and intelligent prof. Played music at the beginning of every class. Engaging, guest speakers and overall interesting content.
Get ready to answer questions during lectures. Also DO NOT FORGET to turn in the FINAL ESSAY ASSIGNMENT DURING the LAST (maybe 2nd to last) LECTURE!

Pros:
- lots of reading
- a few opportunities to practice essay writing
- not many assignments

Cons:
- lots of reading
- niche topics
- nasally speaking voice
- lecture is a ramble, not as helpful as TA sessions. 
- McCall will create open a discussion for the students, then recycle the ideas for her next lecture.
Loved the lectures; grading comes from your TA's rather than the prof. Pretty easy class overall as long as you understand a couple of the text well

McCall's lectures were engaging, and included important insights on stories and essay feedback/information. Try to attend them all if you can because there are also participation activities that count towards your mark. Attending and speaking in tutorials is graded too so go to those! Readings were interesting and essays were simple.

Lectures and tutorials were chill; texts were also pretty interesting and enlightening focusing on a bunch of different cultural/topical issues. Dr. McCall always made sure people were comfortable when it came to some of the more heavier topics the texts introduced; also gave lots of prep and tips for the essays and final which helped a lot.

Super fun, enthusiastic professor. Often does activities in-lecture that count towards your participation, so make sure to attend them. Readings overall were not difficult; there was a wide range from graphic novels to poetry to traditional novels. Your grades are decided more by your TA so attend/participate in tutorials too!

Material in lectures was helpful in writing the papers. I never read the books themselves; you can scrape by on Litcharts, as you're not required to know the specifics of the books, just the gist of it and then connect it to a certain theme--last semester's was "recognition." The amount of writing isn't super onerous. Only like 12 pages for the sem

I highly recommend taking this class with another prof. This was a first year course but it's as if he expects you to come in having already mastered how to analyze english literature. His lectures were long and vague as were his responses to questions. He shut down students ideas in class and the comments on assignments were borderline rude.

Kandice is an awesome professor, the best I've encountered so far. Her ability to express the significance of what each text achieves through its word choice and nuances without constantly referring to the slides is phenomenal. She sold me on being an English major. Big thanks to her!!

His lecture is funny and not hard at all. He is always kind and loves to listen to your ideas all the time. If you have any problems or questions, he always helps you in advance. One of my favorite prof in SFU.
Best professor ever! You will regreat it if you choose others.
Perfect! Perfect! Perfect!
Best professor ever!!!! Love it!!!
He's the sweetest prof I've had a class with on FIC, he is patient and gives chances if he sees your interest in doing good in his class. He's amazing.
Jordan is very kind. You will not regret taking his class. He is also caring and understands students if we have some problems.

He's definitely one of the best professors in my whole life. He's so caring and his advice on writing skills is priceless. Just follow his instructions and try your best to write, don't copy on the Internet, you'll be fine. Just take his course or you'll regret :D
Thank you!
Best teacher ever that I have met. His lecture fantastic and he is an inspiring teacher. The novel is really interesting. Work hard you will pass the course with a good grade.
hes fine

Even though I like his lectures and how he interacts with students, it felt like it was not really possible to get higher than B+. Yes, he makes sure that you pass the course but if you want to get high marks you need to think & write like Shakespeare.
Her lectures are completely off topic to what you will be graded on. No aspects of writing are given, she just summarizes the books you are already going to read.
